page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The small village of Keig, comprising 28 houses, a general merchant's shop and sub post office and a primary school, faces south over the Don valley. The church is sited on the hill behind the village. Northwards is the road to Insch which passes over the Brindy Hill where the land becomes increasingly hilly and barren compared to the fertile valley of the Don. Much of the best agricultural land in the area is in Castle Forbes Home Farm (part of Harthill Farms) through which the river flows. Buildings of note are Castle Forbes which dates from 1815 and Auchnagathle House lying to the east of the Insch road. Further to the east is the densely wooded Lord's Throat road leading to Inverurie.
